\xbd January 14
column2:
2018
I\'m a recent fan
column4: and I\'m not attached to the canon that took place before The Force Awakens. The character that intrigues me the most
column5: and who is the reason my interest in Star Wars has not only continued but grown
column6: is Kylo Ren. I wasn\'t sure what to think of him in TFA; I felt disgust and horror at his actions and immaturity
column7: but also reluctant admiration for his strength and stamina. That\'s one powerful
column10: I\'m simply fascinated by his character development. I\'ve seen TLJ four times in theatres--unprecedented for me--so that I can watch the interactions between him and Rey; I swear every time I notice more nuances in his expression and demeanor that have me rethinking his motivations. He seems to wear his emotions on his sleeve
column11: yet I\'m never convinced I know exactly what he\'s thinking. Rey
column13: is as easy to read as a large-print book
column14: but that suits the character. All of the performances were great
column16:
Adam Driver is exceptionally talented.

What I could have done without in this movie is everything to do with the Finn and Rose storyline. I don\'t care that much about Finn as a character (I was okay with what he wanted to do at the end)
column17: and though I do like Rose
column18:
I was so engrossed in the rest of the story that I was impatient for their irrelevant scenes to end. I know which chapters on the bluray I\'ll be skipping--and I know which ones I\'ll play on repeat.

I liked Poe more this time around
column20: wanted to stand up and cheer for Holdo
column21: wanted to smack Luke upside the head (with affection
column23: and I\'m still torn as far as Leia\'s concerned. On one hand
column24: I\'m saddened and disappointed that she wasn\'t the mother Ben needed
column26: I sympathize with and have respect for the strong woman who survived so many trials and tribulations. I mean
column27: no one can do it all
column28: and it\'s interesting that she\'s a better general than mother (which is debatable
column29:
considering how much ground the Resistance has lost). Usually it\'s fathers who take that stance. I cannot imagine what they\'ll do with her character in IX without Carrie Fisher (R.I.P.).

I\'m very excited for the next episode; I would much rather see IX this year than the Han Solo movie. '

John R
January 14
column37:
2018
Average at best. No real plot twists and plot all together was bad. Killing off Snoke right away??? Looked like they were going to expand on the force and didn\'t. What was that part when she was in the pit..no explanation. Also Kylo goes from not being sure if he\'s good or bad to being bad and killing all the other students? That made no sense. Everything was kind of rushed through. No good character development at all. Lukes acting was average. I didn\'t mind how he died at all and actually thought it was one of the few bright spots his final fight. Just nowhere near the force awakens. I guess because all the summer movies sucked Hollywood is grasping at straws. Effects were decent.. I love the guy who says if you don\'t like the movie we don\'t like diversity so now this is a diversity thing hahah oh man. Great way to rate a movie. Bottom line Johnson is not a good director at all. Bring back Force Awakens director!!
'

Simon H
\xbd January 14
column44:
2018
This movie will go down in cinematic history as the best/worst example of what not to do with a middle film in a trilogy of movies with established series/lore.

Despite the fact this movie is visually stunning and sounds amazing the story was depressingly dull with no world building
column46:
no tension giving us characters
unbelievably stupid (especially if they were male)
with cringe inducing comedy moments that systematically trashed any chance of drama.

The movie systematically either ruined or ignored all of the interesting questions and mysteries of the TFA and criminally shoe horned politics into the narrative at the expense of
story at every given opportunity.

Rian Johnson took a giant dump on this franchise and I am astonished Disney let this slide. Easily the worse Star ars movie ever put to screen. The huge fallout and reduced
sales should be enough to let Disney officials understand that ths movie was not good enough. Star Wars is not bullet proof. Not good enough. '

column48:
2018
This movie was an absolute flop for multiple reasons. (SPOILERS AHEAD)

To start
column49: dry humor is continuously forced down your throat in the beginning of the movie
column50:
only to suddenly drop off without warning. It is awkward and poorly paced.

People outside of the Skywalker family having Force abilities IS NOT new. It has been established in canon multiple times. It is nit groundbreaking or revolutionary. It is just untasteful repitition in attempt to be quirky.

The destruction and regression of the charatcers is another huge thing. Remember
column51: this movie takes place a day after TFA and is about a span of a week. Rey
column52: who absolutely DESPISED Kylo to begin with
column53: ships herself into the enemy\'s hands because she has apparently forgotten all of the stuff Kylo put her through. Leia barely bats an eye after losing her husband AND her brother literally days apart. Also she suddenly gives you on her son
column54:
literally after stating that she believes there is still good in him?

Luke. Possibly the worst. A man who saw the good in his father
column55: who killed children and innocents atop many other things
column56: when no one else would. Luke would never DARE think about killing a SLEEPING CHILD
column57: who hadn\'t even turned to the dark yet
column58:
because he was "scared".

Finn barely developed and that is sad. Have you all forgotten that Finn came from nothing? And yet Rian reduces him to practically nothing.

General Hux did not fear Kylo or Snoke and was terrifying
column59:
yet he\'s reduced to a coward and a comedic relief.

Snoke and Phasma were unceremoniously killed off after greatly teasing their importance and the mystery surrounding them.

Also
column60: the forced romance was NOT needed
column61: it was actually repulsive. Kylo abused Rey and manipulated her
column62:
yet she feels compelled to help him and symphathize with him? Rose suddenly loves Finn after knowing him for two days? Yikes.

And ultimately
column63: Star Wars has ALWAYS been about family. If you want something new
column64:
then the Skywalker epilogue isn\'t for you.

Let me make it clear that the reviews for this movie aren\'t bad because some "men despise the female lead". If it was truly about that
column65: then TFA would have suffered the same way. This isn\'t just a bad Star Wars movie
column66: it is just a bad movie in general. Rian Johnson has poor writing abilities. It was his job to tie TLJ to TFA
column67:
yet he chose to ignore almost everything and made something that lacks continuity.

I would suggest not wasting your money and time on this movie. '

Cesar C
\xbd January 14
column102:
2018
Star Wars is dead. Disney holds the knife.

I\'d give this movie a lower rating
column103:
if one existed.

I\'m a Star Wars fan
column104: and have been for years. This film was a deliberate kick in the face to people like myself. Worse
column105:
it was a shovel full of shit to the face. Never have I felt so disrespected before in film history.

Here\'s a question that I want answered: Why the f*** would I ever watch a Star Wars move after this one again? There is nothing left
column106: no story thread worth pursuing. Anything that was interesting from this universe has been erased. Every character that made Star Wars iconic has been killed
column107:
and in a very unsatisfactory manner.

This film goes out of it\'s way to insult the viewer. Maybe the prequels weren\'t going to win any Oscars
column108: but at least I didn\'t feel like George Lucas wanted to punch me in the face
column109:
or that he despised me and wanted me to suffer. They are masterpieces in comparison to this garbage.

The writers of this film obviously have a deep
column111: seething resentment. They take it out on the fanbase (no surprise as to them probably 80% of Star Wars fans are old school straight males). Superfeminist Kathleen Kennedy and gay man Rian Johnson have a vendetta against the viewer
column112: and they really go out of their way to make us suffer
column113:
probably for the crime of being born.

Let me say I don\'t give a damn about politics. I\'m a liberal
column114: I believe in letting anyone do whatever the hell they want
column115:
as long as they don\'t bother me. I wish films could be free of political agendas but sadly this is becoming less and less common in our world.

The creators sacrificed good storytelling in lieu of pushing an agenda. The story is pathetic
column117: full of plotholes and pointless. It has no beginning
column118: middle or end. They do not even mildly follow the story of TFA. It\'s like a reboot of a reboot
column119: no continuity whatsoever. There is a casino planet full of evil white people (I challenge you to find any "diversity" amongst the tuxedo-wearing
column122: an asian chick that has no point in existing. Even Finn\'s character was butchered
column123:
reverting into the coward he was in the beginning of TFA.

But the biggest coward of all is Luke Skywalker. Things got rough so he fled the known galaxy
column124: spending his days cut off from the force
column125: doing practically nothing and milking the tits of a purposefully disgusting
column128: who defeated Vader and was a hero of the rebellion
column129: who stood unarmed before the emperor with no fear
column130: left his sister alone to fight against evil. Even when he found out his best friend Han Solo
column131: (who on several occasions saved Luke\'s life)
column133: he just cries and whines some more
column135: the eternal optimist and the bravest soul in the galaxy
column136: was absolutely and completely butchered. Quoting Mark Hamill
column137: "This is not Luke anymore. Maybe it\'s Jake Skywalker
column138: but he\'s not my Luke Skywalker." He was purposefully humiliated
column139:
and his character destroyed.

I will never watch a movie from these filmakers ever again. If someone enters your house
column140: smashes your toys and shits on your rug
column141:
that is not "being bold"; that is insulting. You never invite that person over again.

These movies are statement pieces
column142: nothing more. They are meant to deconstruct cultural icons
column144: and replace them with concepts of "diversity"
column145: and "feminism". They destroy Luke because he symbolizes classic heroism
column147: embodied in a simple man. Cultural Marxists abhore tradition
column149: and traditional ideals. Destroy the world
column150:
and rebuild it into what you want it to be. They clearly state for you exactly what they want to do with this franchise; let the past die... kill it if you have to.?

Avoid at all costs. Star Wars is dead. '
